result.execSummary:
The defendant Eugene Louis Richards was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endangering Safety by use of Dangerous Weapon While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  


Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, concurrent to any other sentence, with credit for 23  days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
     *   No firearms; weapons
     *   Defendant to pay all costs and surcharges by 1/9/2017. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 

 Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights and Pretrial Incarceration Credit,received and filed

Defendant Eugene Louis Richards in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  


Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Attorney Joel Alan Mogren in court, defendant Eugene Louis Richards not in court, in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin. For reasons stated on the record, Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 31.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug tests and portable breathalyzers.  
Scram bracelet ordered to monitor defendant maintains absolute sobriety.   
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Eugene Louis Richards in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Defendant Eugene Louis Richards in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for December 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($750.00 signature bond) gj
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 750.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Eugene Louis Richards not in court.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.
-To Withdraw from Attorney Mark Pecora; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Eugene Louis Richards in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.

CASE RECALLED AT 9:22 A.M.

Present in court is WCS Case Worker Erica Perez-Torres related to case #'s 15CM2053 and 15CT755 for WCS report clarification. Defendant needs additional time to complete treatment. Court ordered defendant report to WCS Program immediately after today's proceedings.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Eugene Louis Richards in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. For reasons stated on the record,   Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Eugene Louis Richards in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Pre-trial conference held off the record.    Defense counsel has received discovery and offer, additional time for review of discovery. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Eugene Louis Richards in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Defendant Eugene Louis Richards in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Eugene Louis Richards not in court.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 4/20/15 @ 1:30 pm
